input_text:
Job Title: Sr Manager, Clinical Operations (DaVita IKC)

Location: Houston, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
2800 North Loop W, Houston, Texas, 77092-8838, United States of America

DaVita IKC (Integrated Kidney Care) is comprised of an innovative team that is committed to improving patient outcomes and improving quality of life. Come work with a team of passionate professionals to transform kidney care through a value-based, person-centered, comprehensive approach to kidney care.

The Integrate Kidney Care (IKC) Sr. Regional Operations Manager will lead the local IKC team (Regional Operations Supervisor, RNs and Care Coordinators). You will engage and collaborate with the other IKC teammates, and local dialysis providers to implement clinical initiatives, processes and procedures, and care plan developments for IKC patients.

Clinical Experience Required: Nurse Practitioner (preferred) or Registered NurseLocation: Must be located in XXXXX with the ability to conduct regional travel within XXXXX.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

The ideal candidate will be responsible for leading a team of IKC RNs & IKC Care Coordinators who manage CKD and ESKD patients; responsible for team performance, productivity, and engagement and retention.

In partnership with the Market Director and Nurse Practitioner Manager, you will build and maintain effective communications between market partners, resulting in strong relationships supportive of patient outcomes.Prioritizing patient visits to improve health outcomes and reduce hospitalizations.Measure and track patient data and effectively communicate outcomes.Provide clinical support/ oversight to IKC Registered Nurses- (RN Care Managers) * Nurse Practitioner or Registered Nurse license Required *Complete audits on care plans, TOC and overall quality. And develop action plans to address gaps or deficiencies.Monitor risk management and quality assurance compliance.Manage all teammate employment/ HR activity such as scheduling, payroll, PTO, development plans, hiring, promoting, job performance, evaluations, and disciplinary actions with appropriate approvals as requiredManage regional budget- ensuring cost-effectiveness and appropriate operational expenses. Create and submit financial reports and analysis as needed.Travel required: 25% or more depending on the needs of the team, patients and providers.

Qualifications:

Minimum of five (5) years’ experience in clinical nursing highly preferred; Nurse Practitioner (NP) or Registered Nurse (RN) requiredMinimum of 2 years’ experience leading and managing teams requiredExperience in co-morbid, chronic disease, or nephrology exp. preferred.Demonstrated experience managing to data-driven outcomes and process improvement requiredStrong communication on medical management, operational, and business-related issuesCurrent CPR/BLS certification requiredIntermediate computer skills and proficiency in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook requiredHome office with Internet connectivity at minimum of 1MB upload and 1MB download speed required

At DaVita, we strive to be a community first and a company second. We want all teammates to experience DaVita as "a place where I belong." Our goal is to embed Diversity & Belonging into everything we do in our Village, so that it becomes part of who we are. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. As such, individuals are recruited, hired, assigned and promoted without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or any other protected characteristic.

At DaVita, we strive to be a community first and a company second. We want all teammates to experience DaVita as "a place where I belong." Our goal is to embed Diversity & Belonging into everything we do in our Village, so that it becomes part of who we are. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. As such, individuals are recruited, hired, assigned and promoted without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or any other protected characteristic.

Applications are accepted on an ongoing basis.

Salary/ Wage Range

Compensation for the role will depend on a number of factors, including a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies and experience and may fall outside of the range shown. DaVita offers a competitive total rewards package, which includes a 401k match, healthcare coverage and a broad range of other benefits. Learn more at https://careers.davita.com/benefits

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
